text.content: Dhurandhar box office Day 34: Ranveers film crosses Pushpa 2, nears Rs 1300 crore - India Today India Today Aaj Tak GNTTV Lallantop Business Today Bangla Malayalam Northeast BT Bazaar Harper's Bazaar Sports Tak Crime Tak Astro Tak Gaming Brides Today Cosmopolitan Kisan Tak Ishq FM India Today Hindi Readers Digest India Today Aaj Tak GNTTV Lallantop Business Today Bangla Malayalam Northeast BT Bazaar Harper's Bazaar Sports Tak Magazine Live TV Search SEARCH SIGN IN Edition IN IN US Home TV Live TV Primetime Magazine Latest Edition Insight Best Colleges Puzzles Life+Style India South Global All World News US News Canada News UK News China News Indians Abroad Business Sports All Sports Cricket WPL WPL Schedule Tennis Football Live Score Technology Showbuzz Entertainment Movies Bollywood Hollywood Television OTT Latest Reviews Newspresso Specials Podcasts Sunday Special History of It NewsMo DIU Opinion Videos Short Videos Fact Check Other News Education It's Viral Science Health Auto Law Today Environment Cities Weather Web Stories Horoscopes Election Hub Elections Tamil Nadu Election Kerala Election West Bengal Election Puducherry Election Assam Election Tamil Nadu Schedule Kerala Schedule West Bengal Schedule Puducherry Schedule Assam Schedule Download App Follow Us On: News Movies Bollywood Dhurandhar box office Day 34: Ranveers film crosses Pushpa 2, nears Rs 1300 crore Dhurandhar box office Day 34: Ranveer's film crosses Pushpa 2, nears Rs 1300 crore Dhurandhar, directed by Aditya Dhar and starring Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna, has officially become the highest-earning Hindi film of all time, surpassing previous benchmarks with a total India net collection of Rs 831.40 crore and a worldwide gross of Rs 1,227 crore at the end of day 34 Live TV Share Advertisement Ranveer Singh as Hamza in Dhurandhar. India Today Entertainment Desk New Delhi , UPDATED: Jan 8, 2026 09:40 IST Dhurandhar , the action drama directed by Aditya Dhar, has made history at the Indian box office. On Wednesday, January 7, 2026, the film became the highest-earning Hindi film ever, overtaking the previous record held by Allu Arjuns Pushpa 2: The Rule . With this achievement, Dhurandhar continues a strong run in cinemas across India and abroad, drawing sustained audience interest well into its fifth week. advertisement The film's India net collection reached an estimated Rs 831.40 crore at the end of day 34, according to figures released by the producers. Its total worldwide gross has climbed to approximately Rs 1,227 crore, which includes Rs 943 crore in India and Rs 284 crore from overseas markets. The Hindi version alone recorded over 10% occupancy on its fifth Wednesday, a remarkable feat for a film more than a month into its release. In comparison to other major releases, Dhurandhar surpassed Pushpa 2: The Rule's Hindi lifetime total of around Rs 830 crore net. It also outperformed past blockbusters like Shah Rukh Khans Jawan (RS 643 crore net) and the horror-comedy Stree 2 (Rs 627 crore net), firmly establishing its place at the top of the Hindi film earnings chart. According to box office tracking, the film earned approximately Rs 4.25 crore on day 34. Throughout its run, the movie has consistently posted strong weekly collections, with week five's net total standing at Rs 47 crore. Dhurandhar recorded the highest fifth week collections in recent years, including an estimated RS 33.25 crore over just three days, overtaking Chhaava's previous record. Dhurandhar 's regional performance remains strong, particularly in major cities like Mumbai, Bengaluru, Chennai, and Pune, each recording above 10 per cent occupancy. For instance, Chennai recorded an occupancy rate of 24.5 per cent on Wednesday, while Bengaluru reached 15.75 per cent. These figures highlight the film's widespread appeal and enduring presence in multiplexes nationwide. The makers of Dhurandhar released an official statement acknowledging the film's unprecedented success: "History has b

Newsletters Switch edition between U.S. Edition Asia Edition Global Edition U.S. Asia Global Variety Plus Icon Click to expand the Mega Menu Plus Icon Click to Expand Search Input Variety Plus Icon Read Next: Buffalo 8 Nabs North American Distribution Rights to Edgar Allan Poe Adaptation The Raven (EXCLUSIVE) Home Film Box Office Jan 7, 2026 1:38am PT Ranveer Singhs Dhurandhar Becomes Highest-Grossing Hindi-Language Film in India By Naman Ramachandran Plus Icon Naman Ramachandran Latest Louis Koos Back to the Past Sets North American Release With Well Go USA 14 hours ago Japan, India-Set Romance Him, Her and Fuji Unveils First Looks (EXCLUSIVE) 19 hours ago Life of Pi Star Suraj Sharma Joins Glee Actor Iqbal Theba in Dramedy Days With Dandekar (EXCLUSIVE) 20 hours ago See All Jio Studio/B62 Studios Dhurandhar , starring Ranveer Singh , has overtaken the Hindi dubbed version of Pushpa 2: The Rule to become the highest-grossing Hindi-language film in India. Aditya Dhar directed the film, with Jio Studios and B62 Studios producing. Singhleads the cast, with Akshaye Khanna playing the antagonist. The cast also includes Sanjay Dutt, R. Madhavan, Arjun Rampal, Sara Arjun, Rakesh Bedi, Manav Gohil, Danish Pandor, Saumya Tandon, Gaurav Gera and Naveen Kaushik. Related Stories Spotify Confirms ICE Recruitment Ads Are No Longer Running on Platform This David Bowie Photo Collection Features Never-Before-Seen Shots of the Pop Star's Many Personas -- From Major Tom to Ziggy Stardust The films India box office currently stands at INR981.05 crore ($109 million), and the international gross is $30.5 million, per numbers provided by Jio Studios. Popular on Variety Dhurandhar is told in two parts, with the first installment following a decade-long Indian intelligence operation where an undercover agent infiltrates Karachis criminal and political underworld. The sequel is expected to continue from the cliffhanger ending. International records for Dhurandhar include being the no. 1 Hindi-language film of all time in North America; the no. 2 Indian film of all time in North America; the no. 1 Indian film of all time in Canada and Australia; and the no. 4 Indian film of all time in the U.K., per Jio Studios. In the pantheon of all-time highest grossers locally in India, Dhurandhar is currently at no. 4, behind Baahubali 2: The Conclusion ($159 million, Telugu-language and dubbed versions), Pushpa 2: The Rule ($153.5 million, Telugu-language and dubbed versions), and K.G.F: Chapter 2 ($112 million, Kannada-language and dubbed versions). Among the highest grossing Indian films of all time worldwide, Dhurandhar currently occupies the fifth spot behind Dangal ($244.5 million), Baahubali 2: The Conclusion ($201.2 million), Pushpa 2: The Rule ($200 million) and RRR ($154 million). Dhurandhar 2 will bow March 19, simultaneously releasing in the Hindi, Telugu, Tamil, Kannada and Malayalam languages in a pan-India and global rollout a significant expansion from the originals Hindi-only theatrical run. The decision to mount a five-language release came in response to unprecedented demand from South Indian markets, despite the first films Hindi-only availability. Read further to know the detailed box office report. Advertisement Dhurandhar emerged as India's highest grossing Hindi film. Image Source : TMDB Written By: Twinkle Gupta Published: January 08, 2026 9:56 IST , Updated: January 08, 2026 9:56 IST New Delhi: Ranveer Singh 's spy thriller Dhurandhar has become India's highest-grossing Hindi film. Directed by Aditya Dhar, the film saw a dip in its collections during the fifth week, earning single-digit crores on its fifth Friday, but bounced back over the weekend. Advertisement Despite the slowdown, the film continues to dominate the Indian box office. Notably, it recorded a 62.75% drop on Day 32, its fifth Monday, earning Rs 4.75 crore. According to industry tracker Sacnilk, Dhurandhar has earned Rs 1,222 crore worldwide and is set to surpass the global collection of Jr NTR and Ram Charan's RRR in the coming days. Advertisement Dhurandhar becomes highest-grossing Hindi film Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar has emerged as the highest-grossing single-language Indian film of all time. The film has been running in theatres for 34 days, earning Rs 786 crore in India. On Day 34, it collected 4.25 crore, with an overall Hindi occupancy of 10.69% on Wednesday, January 7, 2026. The spy action thriller Dhurandhar features an esemble star cast including Ranveer Singh, Akshaye Khanna, Arjun Rampal, Sanjay Dutt, and R Madhavan in pivotal roles. The makers already announced its Part 2, which is set to be released on March 2026, clashing with Yash's Toxic A Fairytale for Grown-Ups. Dhurandhar set to beat RRR's worldwide collection According to industry tracker Sacnilk, Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna's Dhurandhar is closing in on the worldwide collection of SS Rajamouli's RRR. So far, the Bollywood film has earned Rs 1,222 crore globally. For comparison, Jr NTR and Ram Charan's RRR has collected Rs 1,230 crore worldwide. Ikkis box office collection Dharmendra and Agastya Nanda's Ikkis collected Rs 1.15 crore on its seventh day at the Indian box office, bringing its total collection to Rs 24.25 crore. Sriram Raghavan's directorial opened with Rs 7 crore on its first day, followed by Rs 3.5 crore on Day 2, Rs 4.65 crore on Day 3, and 5 crore on Day 5. The film saw its first drop in earnings on Day 5, its first Monday, collecting Rs 1.35 crore. On Day 6, it earned Rs 1.6 crore. Also Read: YRF hails Dhurandhar for becoming highest-gr

In a month, the movie has surpassed several past box office hits, setting new benchmarks. Dhurandhar is unstoppable at the box office! Released on Dec 5, the movie has completed one month at the box office and is showing no signs of slowing down. With each passing day, the movie continues to create history at the box office and shatter records. Directed by Aditya Dhar, this action spectacle tells the thrilling story of an Indian spy who goes undercover to infiltrate the roots of terrorism in Pakistan. Dhurandhar box office: How much has the movie earned so far? Total: 831.40 cr,'' Adarsh wrote in a post on X. The movie has now surpassed the lifetime business of Allu Arjun's Pushpa2 Hindi. The movie has also overtaken SS Rajamouli's RRR domestic box office collection, which is Rs 782 crore. However, looking at the overall worldwide numbers, the movie is still behind. With the collection of Rs 1,253.83 crore, the movie is behind Dangal(1,968.032,200 crore), Baahubali 2: The Conclusion(1,810.60 crore), Pushpa 2: The Rule(Rs 1,6421,800 crore), RRR(1,3001,387 crore). In a note shared on X, they wrote,Dhurandhar is not a film... it's a milestone moment in Indian cinema that will be remembered forever.
